intro: Clutia sonderiana var. pubescens, commonly known as the hairy clutia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its pubescent (hairy) stems and leaves, which give it its varietal name. It produces small, white or yellowish flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. The plant is typically found in moist, shaded areas and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
